cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles NNE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest and expected to recurve north-north-eastward over the western Atlantic, staying well north of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands and eventually turning toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall currently forecast – system remains over open Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands (rain), southeastern Bahamas (later), Bermuda (early next week)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–35 mph possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely at the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–3 inches of rain could trigger localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches
